overviewAndMission.purposeStatement: Guardians of nature for the benefit of all
overviewAndMission.mission: To conserve biodiversity for future generations through nature-based solutions
overviewAndMission.vision: To be a role model for integrated conservation
strategicObjectives: Manage a healthy habitat for wildlife and livestock
Support sustainable community development and engagement in conservation
Achieve operational excellence and financial sustainability
Engage and support a high performing team

locationAndSize.landscape: Prime wildlife habitat and ranching land
locationAndSize.view: Overlooked by snow-capped peaks of Mount Kenya

events: Purchased by prominent British settler Lord Delamere
Operated as successful cattle ranch
Later owned by arms dealer Adnan Khashoggi
Kenya suffered serious poaching crisis
Drastic decline in wildlife populations (elephants and rhinos)
Owner Lonrho Africa recognized urgency
Established Sweetwaters Game Reserve adjacent to ranch
Famous Sweetwaters Chimpanzee Sanctuary built
Dedicated to chimpanzees rescued from illegal wildlife trade
Flora and Fauna International and partners acquired the land
Secured future as Ol Pejeta Conservancy
Prevented agricultural development
Community development programme launched
Education scholarships initiated
Livelihoods support programs established
Received last four northern white rhinos
Goal: Natural environment might stimulate reproduction
Achieved IUCN Green List status
One of only five conservancies in Africa with this recognition
Acknowledged importance of landscape in Kenya and Africa
Celebrated 20 years as conservancy
Looking toward sustainable future for wildlife and people

olPejetaRanchingLtd.function: Generates income from tourism and agriculture

olPejetaConservancyLtd.revenueModel: Revenue reinvested into wildlife management, habitat conservation, and community development

olPejetaUK.function: Raises philanthropic and grants-based funding globally
olPejetaUK.address: Countryside House, 23 West Bar Street, Banbury, Oxfordshire OX16 9SA

boardOfDirectors.name: Major General (Rtd) Michael Gichangi EGH, CBS, DCO

blackRhinos.population: Holds largest single population of eastern black rhinos in Kenya

northernWhiteRhinos.population: Home to the last two northern white rhinos on Earth
northernWhiteRhinos.conservationEfforts: Working with partners to save species from extinction with round-the-clock care.

sudan.adoption: Can be adopted 'In Memory of Sudan'

baraka.visitorInteraction: Visitors can take selfies, feed, and touch Baraka

benefits: Name formally entered into Kenyan Wildlife Service (KWS) rhino database
Name certified and recorded in history forever
Welcome brochure with rhino's life story
Protection and support for rhino's survival
Ability to visit rhino with dedicated ranger
supportProvided: Investment in rhino conservation and protection

sanctuary.name: Sweetwaters Chimpanzee Sanctuary
sanctuary.background: Chimpanzees are not indigenous to Kenya; sanctuary houses individuals rescued from the illegal wildlife trade.

k9Unit.description: Famous bloodhounds with exceptional scent-tracking skills

entryFees.notes: Children are 3-11 years old. Children below 3 are free.

policies.onlineBooking: First wildlife conservancy in Kenya with online entry fee booking. Activities and campsites can also be booked online.
policies.singleEntry: Ticket is valid for one entry only. Re-entry requires a new fee.

studentEntry.booking: Must pre-book to receive concession rate.
studentEntry.requirements: Must be accompanied by a teacher and/or letter from a recognised learning institution.
studentEntry.teacherEntry: Two teachers per group enter for free.
studentEntry.guide: Available for a fee of Ksh 2,500.

entryFeeInclusions.description: Meet our closest living relatives and learn about their incredible stories, personalities and behaviours.
Take unbelievable selfies as you feed and touch a real live black rhino and learn about Baraka.
Make unforgettable memories as you roam the Ol Pejeta landscapes and see wild animals.

details: Off-road driving strictly prohibited unless approved.
Do not exit vehicle unless in a designated area.
Wildlife always has right of way.
Do not chase, follow, harass, or feed animals.
Do not sit or stand on vehicle's roof.
Do not discard litter or cigarette butts.
Do not damage or remove any flora or fauna, including bones.
No firearms, spears, bows, or arrows.
Obtain an official receipt for all transactions.
No use of private drones unless authorized.

safariTips.details: Always carry water in an eco-friendly bottle. Ol Pejeta is plastic-free.
Carry prescription medications and bug spray if allergic.

safariTips.recommendation: Tan, green, or brown (khaki) clothing is advisable. Avoid bright colors.
Closed-toe shoes are essential for protection.
Bring a kikoi or scarf for warmth, protection, or comfort.

safariTips.details: Plastic is banned. Use eco-friendly bags and bottles.

popularExperiences.name: Meet the Last Two Northern White Rhinos
popularExperiences.description: A rare chance to encounter Najin and Fatu and learn their story from their keepers. All proceeds support the species rescue efforts.

popularExperiences.name: Lion Tracking
popularExperiences.description: Follow a skilled tracker to find radio-collared lions and learn fascinating insights about them.

popularExperiences.name: All Day Game Drive
popularExperiences.description: Explore the vast landscapes and encounter a rich array of wildlife in their natural habitat.

popularExperiences.name: Night Game Drive
popularExperiences.description: Experience the African savannah after dark and see nocturnal creatures emerge.

popularExperiences.name: Behind the Scenes with the Chimpanzees
popularExperiences.description: A unique opportunity to view chimpanzees behind the scenes and learn about their day-to-day care.

popularExperiences.name: Dog Tracking
popularExperiences.description: An interactive experience with the K9 unit's bloodhounds. Run and hide, and let the dogs find you.

popularExperiences.name: Livestock-Wildlife Integration
popularExperiences.description: Learn about the unique model of managing 7,000 Boran cattle alongside wildlife to improve grasslands.

popularExperiences.name: Virtual Classroom
activities: Meet the last northern white rhinos
Virtual tour of Sweetwaters Chimpanzee Sanctuary

popularExperiences.name: Guided Bush/Bird Walk
popularExperiences.description: Join rangers on a walk to learn the routes, see wildlife, and gain information about different species.

popularExperiences.name: Rhino Monitoring and Identification
popularExperiences.description: An educational adventure with the Rhino Monitoring team to get up close with the conservancy's signature species.

popularExperiences.name: Conservation Talks
popularExperiences.description: Engage one-on-one with Ol Pejeta’s experts on wildlife, community development, and conservation tech.

menuHighlights: Famous Morani burger (grass-fed beef, cheese, bacon, homemade fries)
moranisRestaurant.sourcing: Homemade from fresh, locally sourced ingredients whenever possible.
moranisRestaurant.specialPackages: Morani’s Sundowner Package available upon request.

theStables.description: Basic but comfortable accommodation, converted from former horse stables.
theStables.powerSchedule: Runs on generator power with a specific schedule for weekdays and weekends.
importantNotes: Conservancy entrance fees are not included.
Guests must have their own vehicle.

campsites.mandatoryRequirement: An armed ranger must accompany campers for a fee of Ksh 5,000 per ranger per night.

sites.name: Ewaso
sites.location: On the banks of the Ewaso Nyiro River.
sites.features: Hidden behind bushy vegetation, perfect for wildlife watching. A favorite spot for elephants and antelopes.

sites.name: Hippo Hide
sites.location: On the banks of the Ewaso Nyiro River, close to the Hippo Hide walkway.
sites.features: Offers chances to see hippos wallowing in shallow waters.

sites.name: Mbogo
sites.features: 'Campers castle on a hill' with views of a lush marsh and plains. Perfect for sundowners.

sites.name: Murera Donga
sites.location: Secluded, next to the marsh area.
sites.features: Surrounded by acacia trees, attracts wildlife year-round due to lush vegetation.

sites.name: Ol Lerai
sites.features: Features a secret island for fishing. Elephants are frequent visitors.

sites.name: Spoonbill
sites.features: Public campsite. Frequently visited by wildlife and spoonbill birds. Exclusive use available for groups of 20+.

sites.name: Scott's Hide
sites.location: Next to a hide overlooking a waterhole on Scott's Plain.
sites.features: Offers close encounters with wildlife who are unaware of human presence.

partnerLodges.name: Kicheche Laikipia Camp
partnerLodges.description: Intimate camp with six tents in the wilderness zone, overlooking a waterhole with views of Mt. Kenya.

partnerLodges.name: Mutara Camp
partnerLodges.description: The only accommodation in the 20,000-acre Mutara Conservancy, bordering Ol Pejeta. High on a cliff-top with panoramic views.

partnerLodges.name: Ol Pejeta Bush Camp
partnerLodges.description: Located in central Laikipia, overlooked by Mt. Kenya, and home to the remaining northern white rhinos.

partnerLodges.name: Ol Pejeta Safari Cottages
partnerLodges.description: Eco-friendly luxury cottages tucked along a river line in the exclusive wilderness area, offering superior service and guiding.

membershipScheme.overview: An annual fee for unlimited entry for one year, available to Kenyan citizens and residents.
terms: Restricted to Kenyan citizens and residents.
Activities and accommodation are subject to availability.
Proof of identity required for application.
Members must abide by the code of conduct.

communityDevelopmentPrograms.overview: The community department works with approx. 45,000 people in 21 designated communities, partnering with government and NGOs to promote improved livelihoods, education, and governance.

education.scholarshipProgram: Over 400 students have benefited from full scholarships and bursaries; 277 currently on 4-year scholarships.
education.digitalLiteracy: ARES program in 35 schools, with over 400 teachers trained.
education.conservationEducation: Free entry for local school children, school visits, and training.
education.mentorshipPrograms: Bi-annual mentorship weeks for scholarship students.

foodSecurity.targetCommunities: Pastoralists in the north and mixed farmers in the south, east, and west.
approaches: Breed and seed improvement (artificial insemination, certified seeds).

enterpriseDevelopment.marketForProduce: Ol Pejeta purchases over KES 8,000,000 worth of produce annually from community farmer groups.
enterpriseDevelopment.jewelryMaking: Support for community women by creating a direct market for tourists.
enterpriseDevelopment.financialSupport: Revolving funds and microfinance for initiatives like water tanks and poultry distribution.

water.focus: Addressing water access in Laikipia's drylands through drought resilience and sustainable resource management.

energy.vision: Create access to affordable, clean energy.

solutions.details: Systems installed in two schools and over 200 households.
Stations in four schools, with over 50 households adopting the technology.
Partnership with Die Ofenmacher has rolled out stoves in over 350 households, reducing firewood consumption by 50%.

animalAdoption.purpose: Support wildlife protection, conservation, and community development.
animalsAvailable: In Memory of Sudan (Northern White Rhino)

impactStatistics.communityImpact: Significant number of lives impacted and bursaries granted (data on website).
impactStatistics.conservationImpact: Positive percentage growth in the black rhino population (data on website).

kenyaOffice.address: Ol Pejeta Conservancy Private Bag, 10400 Nanyuki, Kenya

ukOffice.address: c/o Ellacotts Llp, Countryside House, 23 West Bar Street, BANBURY, Oxfordshire, OX16 9SA
ukOffice.note: Administrative office only - No booking enquiries

additionalServices.newsletterSignUp: Available on the website for tips, information, and support opportunities.
additionalServices.supplierOpportunities: A contact form is available on the website for potential suppliers.
additionalServices.onlineShop: Available for merchandise and support items.

policiesAndDocumentation.strategicPlanning: The 2030 Strategy document is available for reading online.

achievements: First wildlife conservancy in Kenya with online booking for entry fees.
Achieved IUCN Green List status in 2014, one of only five in Africa.
Considered a role model for integrated conservation.
Demonstrated resilience through challenges like COVID-19.

uniqueModels.livestockWildlifeIntegration: A model using a 7,000-strong herd of Boran cattle to manage grasslands and create biodiversity hotspots.

conservationInnovation: Expertise in wildlife and habitat management.
Advanced security systems and conservation technology.
Commitment to knowledge sharing with other conservancies.

bestPractices: Stay in vehicle unless in designated areas.
ecoFriendlyPractices: Do not remove any natural materials.
visitorGuidelinesAndSafety.photography: Capture memories responsibly, respecting animal welfare.
